fields.description:
I've tried to search for any hints on this but couldn't find anything so I'm sorry if I've missed something.

Basically I would like to have the ability to move issues between repositories. The repositories might be related because they are part of a bigger project and a user submitted an issue to the wrong repo, or it could be because the repo is a fork and I would like to move the issue to the main repo.
fields.summary: Move issue between repositories
After changing my login, the bugtracker links should be updated as well (BB-1274)

fields.description:
I eventually figured out how to dismiss the "Send Invitation Dialog", however it is not obvious as there is no cancel or "X" button for closing/dismissing the dialog.

First I went right to the refresh, and that works but is not normal, and then I tried the ESC key which worked, but again not very user friendly method for dismissing dialogs, especially in a Web UI.
fields.summary: No Obvious Way to Dismiss "Send Invitation Dialog"

fields.description:
It would be useful to be able to name and save a query and have it show up in the Issues drop-down.  Both project-wide (defined by admins) and user-specific queries would be useful.

This would facilitate having an "Open issues for <milestone>" issue list easily available.
fields.summary: Add "save query" feature

fields.description:
This project just recently had dozens of followers, but now it suddenly has just a few: https://bitbucket.org/ianb/webob

It seems like it happened when the project owner added a new admin.
fields.summary: All of project's followers were removed (BB-1275)

fields.description: I am trying to edit the title of one of my issues. I click on the title, change it, hit enter, and then it says saving. However if I refresh the page it is not saved. I have tried this in Opera11, Chrome, FireFox, and IE8 without success.
fields.summary: Issue title editing is not working in all browsers for CNAME repo access (BB-1239)

fields.description:
Hi,

Sometimes it is not possible to download the repository through the terminal (due to local connection problems and big repos) so it would be very nice if there was an option to download only the .hg folder instead of the actual sources.

Having the .hg folder one can rebuild the files from there (right now I couldn't download a repo and I had to ask another coworker to pass me his .hg folder).

Regards and thanks in advance
fields.summary: Possibility to download compressed file with repository files

fields.description:
Repro:

* Receive a bug report on a project
* Fork the project and fix bug (but don't merge it back)
* Update bug with a link to the cset that fixes the bug
* Get Wiki macro error because the cset id I entered is in the fork, not in the source repo.

Example https://bitbucket.org/scope/dragonfly-stp-1/issue/51/sorting-resources-by-size-in-resources-tab#comment-371068

fields.description:
My changeset\\
https://bitbucket.org/dalexander/euler/changeset/2200286fb10e

shows only 50 changed files, when in fact the changeset touched 100 files:

mavis:Solutions $ hg log  -r2200286fb10e --stat | tail -2\\
100 files changed, 300 insertions(+), 0 deletions(-)

Even viewing the "raw changeset" appears to show only the first 50 file changes.  All changes, however, were propagated to the bitbucket repo, as can be seen from an "annotate" view of euler099.py, say.
fields.summary: bitbucket only shows part of a large changeset (~100 files changed) (BB-1240)

fields.description:

...
}}}There is apparently some templating styles that use #introduction and apply a dark blue background, so the whole first paragraph of my readme had a dark blue background and could not be read.

I'm trying to upload a file.  I select the file with the file upload form element, submit the form, and the file appears to upload.

The file is a PDF if that matters.

fields.description:
I have a README.rst in the root of my repository. It is rendered as HTML, but not completely.

It looks like only sections are rendered, not the part before the first section where I indicate the title and infos like author, date, license, etc.

This is all the more annoying as this is, as far as I know, a very common way of starting a ReST document.

Compare:

* the ReST source : https://bitbucket.org/gohu/configshare/src/e48029f8516a/README.rst
* the rendered HTML : https://bitbucket.org/gohu/configshare/src/e48029f8516a

and see how everything before the first section is ignored.
fields.summary: Header of ReStructuredText READMEs isn't rendered (BB-1244)

When I run it, nothing comes up, and TaskManager shows SPlayer.exe is consuming more and more memory (starts @ ~13MB and goes all the way to ~1.2GB). Then memory usage (according to TaskManager) decreases, and then eventually disappears from TaskManager.

I will upload the .dmp file as well...

fields.description:
Hi,

Taking this example,

* https://bitbucket.org/cloudengine/cloudengine/wiki/Install#step-7-configure-your-site

I look forward to a fix. Thanks,

Nick

Long lines in a code block "destroy" the layout (see screenshot). Also, this is an example:

{{{\\
MacHg issued(2011-02-08 10:57:14 +0100):\\
/Applications/MacHg.app/Contents/Resources/localhg status --cwd /Users/manski/Documents/Programmieren/mamp-htdocs/wordpress-latest/wp-content --modified --added --removed --no-status /Users/manski/Documents/Programmieren/mamp-htdocs/wordpress-latest/wp-content/.hgignore\\
Result code was:0\\
}}}

You should either wrap this (CSS: "white-space: pre-wrap;") or add scrollbars (CSS: "overflow: scroll;").

Where %username% is a link to user's profile. That's all.

While on main page in my feed you show what page was updated.

fields.description:
== <<issue>> macro

Currently, <<issue i>> creates a link to an issue with the text "#i".

While extremely handy, the link isn't descriptive enough to be self sufficient when reading.  In situation where many <<issue>> macros are present, one must visit each link to properly establish the context.

It would be great if the macro could be directed to display the title of the issue as well as link to the proper URL.

=== Suggested Mechanism ===

I'm not familiar with the development team's preferences on macro syntax or anything, I thought that perhaps something like this would be nice:

==== Case 1 ====

{{{\\
<<issue 6>>\\
}}}

would behave just as it does now, generating a link like <<issue 6>>.

==== Case 2 ====

{{{\\
<<issue 6|arbitrary description>>\\
}}}

Mirroring the link syntax in wikicrole, users could provide any description they would like for the link to create an [[http://www.example.com|arbitrary description]] link.

==== Case 3 ====

{{{\\
<<issue 6|>>\\
}}}

An empty link description would use the issue issue number and title as the link text like "#6 Should be able to link to other issues".
fields.summary: <<issue>> macro, news feed enhancements (BB-1210)

fields.description: I pushed my repository from Eclipse and when I went to my site, it showed as my username was unmapped.  I then had to go map my username to my username.  See attached.
fields.summary: Username mapping issue

fields.description: If a site uses the README file found at https://bitbucket.org/edgimar/pweave/src/1889b0bedafa/README , there will be a large blue box at the top of the bitbucket-rendered display.  This is apparently due to the first section being named "Introduction", which creates an 'introduction' CSS id, that somehow conflicts with Bitbucket's CSS styles.  Changing the name to something else fixes the problem.
fields.summary: Bug in reStructuredText rendering (css name clash)

fields.description:
Pressing "Invite" opens up a modal with form, but it is lacking close button's background image.

The image "ui-icons_2694e8_256x240.png" is missing on your cloudfront CDN.

Could this issue be related to other unbeknown problems?

Feed In Question:\\
https://bitbucket.org/TaintedDev/taintedwow/rss?token=e789cc0cb9bdb373a1cf2377593306b7

i am trying to pull the following feed for my application but there is a problem with the feed it also is not passing validation on most RSS / Atom sites. the error is stating that the xml declaration needs to be first and upon viewing the raw XML there is 2 empty lines before the XML declaration..is there anyway you can check into this and if possible remove any cached copies of the feed.

please e-mail all answers to timelord@timelord83.com

fields.description:
Some files from private repository https://bitbucket.org/pakre/text/ can't be accessed using web interface and 404 error message is shown instead. There is no problem with normal access using mercurial client, though.

This is one of affected files: https://bitbucket.org/pakre/text/src/cff0f5fecaf0/P%C5%99ehled%20literatury1.doc. The file was pushed from windows machine.

It may be related to the fact, that the filename contains diacritic characters and thus related to encoding of the filename. But my quick testing with files with similar name was unable to verify this clam, some files are accesible and others not, see https://bitbucket.org/marbu/jupiter/src.
fields.summary: files can't be accessed via web interface

fields.description:
Would it be possible to get an official test user account with some test repos, test issues and what not?

For most API testing purposes a read-only account would be more than enough, it would just be nice to be able to give people who hold the keys to certain gates (Apple and the App Store) a user with which they can actually test. It would also mean that everyone who wants to do this doesn't have to create a separate account

fields.description:
On the issue screen:\\
https://bitbucket.org/user/project/issue/123/

Add a list of commits that have tagged the issue number in the commit message: //development on *#123*//

The person reviewing a resolved issue is often different from the person who completed the commit. This would be a very useful addition.

Note the double // after bitbucket.org

In IE 7, the menus such as the "Repositories" menu unfold when hovered, however they unfold in background and one cannot click any menu item. It would be very helpful if this can be fixed.

fields.description:
While browsing a repository on a custom hostname ( http://code.yogipatel.net/test ), the username link links to the repository URL, not the user.

For example, at the above URL, the path shown in the header is "yogi / test". test links to the repo correctly. yogi links to the repo as well though — not the user profile page (which should be http://code.yogipatel.net ).

If it's possible to see BitBucket's source and submit patches, I wouldn't mind fixing this for us :)

Wouldn't mind adding GitHub style project pages / CNAME support either (though that is certainly less trivial).

{{{\\
keramida@bokos:/hg/bsd/head$ hg push bb\\
pushing to ssh://hg@bitbucket.org/keramida/freebsd-head\\
αναζήτηση αλλαγών\\
απομακρυσμένο: abort: abandoned transaction found - run hg recover!\\
abort: unexpected response: empty string\\
keramida@bokos:/hg/bsd/head$\\
}}}

Is there some way I can recover the remote bitbucket.org repository by running "hg recover" on it?

fields.description:
Will be fine if u added some futures from Trac like http://trac.edgewall.org/browser/trunk/contrib/trac-pre-commit-hook (for hg it exists too)

If commit string contains some keywords like '< closed|fixed|done etc> #<issue_id> [commit_msg]' - ticket with issue_id automatically changed status to fixed|closed|done with commit_msg comment and link to commit (i don't saw simple tag for commit at issue editor, this will be fine too :]).

Tnx.
fields.summary: Commit hook for autoset ticket status

Great work Alex and team.

fields.description:
I'm using api for fetching issue data, and when I send request for issue that doesn't exist I get full traceback with information about the server:

{{{

bq. curl -k https://api.bitbucket.org/1.0/repositories/<some_user>/<some_project>/issues/64/


Piston/0.2.3rc1 (Django 1.2.4) crash report:

Traceback (most recent call last):

File "/opt/python/domains/bitbucket.org/2010-09-28/bitbucket/..\\
/bitbucket/apps/api/v10/handlers.py", line 1202, in read\\
return Issue.objects.get(repository=repo, local_id=issue_id)

File "/opt/python/domains/bitbucket.org/2010-09-28\\
/bitbucket/local/env/lib/python2.7/site-packages\\
/django/db/models/manager.py", line 132, in get\\
return self.get_query_set().get(*args, **kwargs)

File "/opt/python/domains/bitbucket.org/2010-09-28\\
/bitbucket/local/env/lib/python2.7/site-packages\\
/django/db/models/query.py", line 347, in get\\
% self.model._meta.object_name)

DoesNotExist: Issue matching query does not exist.\\
}}}

Showing too much data about the server, file locations etc. is not preferred practice (security reasons). I was expecting: Not found (404).
fields.summary: API request for an issue that doesn't exist returns full traceback with information about the server (BB-1155)

fields.description:
The files in my repository in source view are showing ` as the start character, and all tabbing has been removed.

These files are UTF8 with a BOM as far as I know and the raw versions look fine - here's an example:

http://hg.shrinkrays.net/spruce/src/0d00e3c15e2c/Models/WorkItemManager.cs
fields.summary: Source view is showing ` at the start of a file (BB-1156)

fields.description:
Earlier today I was in the process of creating a new issue for a project hosted on bitbucket (tortoisehg) and wrote a pretty lengthy issue message.

When I was ready to submit it, I was scrolled such that the "Report issue" button wasn't visible, and without realizing what I was actually doing (I don't have a lot of experience with bitbucket), I clicked the bold "Create new" link along the top toolbar ("Create new", "All", "Open", "Mine", "Query") above the grey "Create new issue" panel.  This resulted in the loss of my issue text, which was pretty frustrating.

It would be ideal if any action that navigates away from the page would warn that the unsaved data will be lost.  If it isn't feasible to perform this globally, I believe that at least the actions on the toolbar should show an alert prior to navigating away.
fields.summary: Create New Issue page doesn't warn you that you will lose changes when navigating away (BB-1154)

Thanks!

fields.description:
While looking at source code, at least for my project, the code that has been indented with tabs isn't displaying properly.

For example, this is how I format my code:\\
{{{\\
#!php\\
class Foo extends Bar\\
{\\
->function lol($what)\\
->{\\
->->//just a comment..\\
->}\\
}\\
}}}

The "->" means a tab.

But when viewing on BitBucket, the code displays like as if the second indent is gone, as if I have only used one tab...

https://bitbucket.org/dukeofgaming/chibi-nn

fields.description:
It would be useful to support reStructuredText as the wiki markup language, probably with some small extension to make wiki page linking easier.

The main reason for this is so that the wiki and README files use the same markup language.  This will allow the README to be synced with a wiki page if desired (this is desired for one of my projects).  Also, other documentation written in reST can be synced with the wiki.  I imagine that this would be a repository option to make the wiki use reST rather than Creole, or per-page modeline detection (if the wiki page starts with an Emacs or Vim modeline indicating reStructuredText, render it as reST).
fields.summary: Support reStructuredText (and perhaps more) as wiki markup (BB-523)

Last-Modified: Thu, 20 Jan 2011 13:53:38 GMT\\

Bad Request\\

fields.description:
I foolishly committed a large binary file early in my revision history, and wanted to remove it.  I locally used hg convert with a file list to get rid of it, but I needed to clean the bitbucket repo and push the fresh copy.  Upon stripping all the changesets, the reported size of my project remained unchanged despite having 0 reported changesets.

This could indicate either an error in size reporting, or an error in how space is reclaimed after stripping.
fields.summary: Repo Size Remains constant after stripping all revisions (BB-1138)

Zeljko

fields.description:

If, as suggested there, I set the username to hg, then it claims all my commits are by user 'hg' and not by my username.

{{{\\
[ui]\\
username = clrg\\
ssh = C:\Applications\cygwin\bin\ssh.exe\\
}}}

i only have1 e-mail address!

No I constantly get the message "The hostname "xxxxxxx" does not resolve to bitbucket.org. Please check your DNS settings. (Your hostname currently points to x.x.x.x.)" also I am unable to enter another hostname. It just gives the same error everytime.
fields.summary: Cannot change custom hostname, after entering wrong hostname which already exists and points somewhere else.

fields.description: So I added a second email address and now I'm getting my notifications there rather than my primary address.  Is there suppose to be a setting to specify which email address to get my notifications?
fields.summary: Email notification preferences (BB-1119)

fields.description:
We have a system by which all of the authoritative repos are owned by a single role.  As we have many, many repos, this causes the display on this page to run long.

If the column labeled Repositories could be flowed into multiple columns, it would greatly enhance readability and utility.
fields.summary: Multiple column output for user pages

fields.description: I'd really like to have RSS (or email) subscription ability for individual wiki pages, to get notified when a particular wiki changes and point me to a diff.
fields.summary: Wikis have no subscription options (BB-709)

fields.description:
I have a standard login with username dasmith2

I would like to start using Open ID to reduce the hassle of keeping track of my password for bitbucket. There is no obvious way to associate an Open ID with an existing standard login.
fields.summary: Have a standard login, want to use Open ID

fields.description: Gravatar image is not displayed when using custom CNAME.
fields.summary: Gravatar image is not displayed when using custom CNAME (BB-1116)

fields.description: qhdqdsqnm
fields.summary: MicHaelRudy

fields.description:
hard to explain: updates to other projects appear in my login landing page as if they belonged to me. i cannot view the projects.

fullsized screenshot attached.
fields.summary: Dashboard is displaying wrong users information (BB-1129)

fields.description: Parse error: syntax error, unexpected '&' in */codeigniter/system/libraries/Pagination.php* on line 188
fields.summary: unexpected using pagination

fields.description: Please provide the current status of an issue so the users of the API can have a clearer view of what is progress and needs addressing.
fields.summary: API: Current status of an issue (BB-1066)

fields.description: A last modified timestamp on the issues API would enable the users of it to order the issues correctly, currently we can use either create date or issue number.
fields.summary: API: Last modified timestamp (BB-1065)

fields.description: Would it be possible to request the comments made on issues via the API. At the moment the lack of comments makes the issues API a bit toothless, there is nearly no point in having it if you can't view the discussion that has happened.
fields.summary: API: Comments for issues (BB-1064)

fields.description:
I've just commited a change for my project wiki from the web UI, but the change commited twice:

h1. First commit is the change itself
h1. Second commit is empty, but with the same commit message
Just after update there was a notice on top of the page (I can't remember exactly):

{{{\\
NB: ...\\
Updated files 0, Merged 1\\
}}}

Here is a wiki page: [[https://bitbucket.org/zzsergant/hgsccpackage/wiki/Home|https://bitbucket.org/zzsergant/hgsccpackage/wiki/Home]]

Clone the wiki repository and see the revision 90 (Added description for v1.6.1).

How can I strip this empty revision from my wiki repository ?
fields.summary: Wiki change from web UI commited twice (BB-1233)

fields.description:
I have a BB account. But on more than one occasion when I have gone to file an issue report (about my own or someone else's project), the site has accepted by submission as "anonymous user". In fact I meant to submit it as myself, I just did not realize I was already logged in; BB seems to log me off after some time.

While there may be some value in permitting anonymous issue reports (I don't see what), please at least ask for confirmation that you intend you submit anonymously, with an option to log in first.
fields.summary: Not prompted to log in before filing issue (BB-1115)

fields.description:
I like the new invite feature on the repository dashboard.

I would like to be able to invite my colleagues to access to all the company's private repositories, an addition to the discrete repositories.
fields.summary: invite to account in addition to single repository (BB-1114)

fields.description: demjson returns unicode codes,while in twisted,it will case an TypeError with "Data must not be unicode",I advices you remove demjson in json.py
fields.summary: demjson cause TypeError in twisted

fields.description:
The dashboard only shows a limited number of items and for one of my active projects only has about 18 hours of activity.

Please add 'Next' pages so I can browse a bit further back in time.

(I also have an RSS subscription but the Google Reader interface lags and the presentation is nowhere near as nice as the Dashboard.)
fields.summary: More pages for dashboard (BB-47)

fields.description:
Hi, I logged in my free account and was notified about an unconfirmed email address today. I then changed on my accpunt page as suggested, to resend the confirmation mail.

A few seconds later I clicked the confirmation link in the received confirmation email and .... nothing changed in the message on top of my repository dashboard.

So could you please provide me some help on handling this error?\\
Thanks in advance\\
Andreas
fields.summary: Confirmation mail

fields.description:
I think bitbucket should start a Mylyn connector for the site. Or migrate the issue software to Atlassian.

There's no way to manipulate issues inside eclipse.

Thanks!

ps: The new UI is becoming amazing!
fields.summary: Mylyn Connector for Bitbucket (BB-1112)

fields.description:
There is a minor UI bug in the source browser of bitbucket: even when the browser's viewport is wide enough to display the source file, there is a visible horizontal scrollbar at the bottom of the page that serves no purpose. I haven't investigated further, but it definitely looks like a small CSS glitch.

Here's a link to one of my source file that exhibits this problem:

https://bitbucket.org/mumux/automata/src/120d63e6991e/Data/Automaton/Class.hs

For what it's worth, I've seen this problem with both Google Chrome 8 as well as Firefox 3 and 4beta8.
fields.summary: Unnecessary horizontal scrollbar in the source browser (BB-1036)

fields.description:
A roadmap of the upcoming changes to the API would be very welcome. Even just a developers mailing list where info on breaking changes and feedback can be given would be nice.

Developing for the iOS platform there are many hoops I have to jump though and knowledge of an upcoming API change would help me schedule when I submit Issue Bucket for review.
fields.summary: API roadmap

fields.description: If there are subrepos in a project, the archive download does not consider them. It might be nice to have the archiver pull that subrepo and include it in the archive
fields.summary: Archive download doesn't consider subrepos (BB-1111)

fields.description:
The User Access list is stuck at loading status.

Same in both my browsers:

* Chrome 8.0.552.224
* IE 8

Chromes thorows the following JavaScript error:

// Failed to load resource: the server responded with a status of 404 (NOT FOUND) http://code.brightcabin.se/api/1.0/privileges/nh.dittnyabadrum/admin//
fields.summary: Repo -> Admin -> User Access, stuck at Loading....

fields.description: I did some commits with empty comment and its now hard to view such changesets cause they dont have title which i can click. It would be nice to display something like "(no commit message)" there...
fields.summary: changesets without comments

fields.description: https://bitbucket.org/lindenlab/viewer-development/descendants displays an error.
fields.summary: Can't see descendants (BB-989)

fields.description: It would be nice to have a list of all tickets I'm following. Currently I can only see which repositories I'm following.
fields.summary: Implement list of tickets I'm following (BB-988)
Can't re-instantiate a deleted repository as a fork (BB-1110)

fields.description:
Hi there,

I recently created a free bitbucket account, however I do not seem to be able to log into the system.

I have also resetted my password several times.

However when I re-attempt to log in, it still denies me access by saying my username/email is invalid.
fields.summary: Problem signing into my account even after reset

fields.description: << changeset xxx>> renders incorrectly in preview panel when adding a comment to a ticket. The link displays as r123:xxx with a href of #.
fields.summary: <<changeset>> renders incorrectly in preview panel when adding a comment to a ticket

fields.description:
example\\
https://bitbucket.org/redmine/redmine/descendants

does have 2 repos, but only one exists anymore, the other one does link to the existing
fields.summary: deleted repos are still listed in search or fork lists (BB-1109)
